Ha, I have to admit they sort of come across as such.  Though, since I'm the uploader, and I know it wasn't me, I figured there was a chance I was being punked; yet, I suppose many folks just don't realize how small a quality h264 can get with just the right encoder options so that was reflected in their comments and ratings (btw, see my x264 encoding guide {link in description above} for the exact options I used to encode this film; I was inspired by newartriot who also uses quality based VBR, instead of fixed bitrate ABR/CBR like most other h264 uploaders.  It's like in the MP3 world; good uploaders use quality based VBR (--preset-standard), not ABR or CBR, for maximum quality with no wasted space.
Enjoy the show,
~ RipMinion ~

> " how fast [to encode]? "

Well, the x264 encoder options that I prefer will likely take somewhat longer; that's intentional as I do not mind spending extra time to make it the smallest possible file while still maintaining high 720p quality.  The short answer is:  about 4 hours on an AMD 3.4GHz Quad-core.
